posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked: Hello, I would be very pleased, if animated Stickers stop moving when selecting another window. It’s quite annoying to see always something moving on my second screen. Thx!

YES!!! Please do the same for Android as well.
IMHO they don’t need to be animated at all in the list of recent chats; only if I’m actually in the chat should they move. It is very distracting…

This should be a setting with an on/off switch. I for one do want the stickers to always move and am quite annoyed but the opposite, when they only move while the window is focused in other applications like discord for example.

It would be nice if gifs and animated stickers would stop from endlessly replaying and looping. At some point these animations become too distracting.

For reference, WhatsApp plays a gif twice I believe and then just stops, and pressing on the gif will result in replaying that gif only for the user pressing on the gif.

link_counts.title: Option to disable animation (eg. animated stickers, transitions, etc.) on all platforms

posts.name: Zack Ts
posts.cooked: Love the loops. Maybe ability to actively stop them would help you too.

Perhaps it would help to have a setting that says “stop gifs and animated stickers loops after 4 times” or something along those lines . And then those who want to stop the endless loops would enable that setting.

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked: Or just simply: stop animation when selecting another window… (I’m running Signal on my second screen)
Not just when selecting another window… even on the active window

posts.name: Paul Schon
posts.cooked: Of course, but then having a switch for playing in loop or only once would be the best!

posts.name: Ivo Hefti
posts.cooked:
As a user I like to have control over (almost) all the settings in an app. One of these things is the option to be able to manually pause a gif. It’s very distracting for me that the gif keeps playing in an endless loop (especially on desktop when I have signal on a second monitor).

Suggestion:
Make it possible to pause a gif manually. Or have some auto-pause feature build in that pauses after X amount of seconds or amount of loops. MS Teams has this feature build in and works very pleasent. (whatsapp also does it in a way).

This feature could be an option flag in the settings to have GIFs auto-play or manually played. Sometimes I dont want to have an annoying GIF being played, or I already know the GIF. I would like to have control over this.

I mean, after 20 loops I for sure know what the GIF is about

posts.name: David Wilcox
posts.cooked:
Hi Signal

Great Software, but can you make the playing of gifs configurable, please?

Options could never, once, twice or continuous.

It’s extremely distracting to have the gifs playing away all the time.

Cheers David

posts.name: Jason
posts.cooked: I would like the ability to pause GIF playback in the desktop apps. When someone sends a GIF in a chat or group chat it plays forever and since I keep the window open at all times it is distracting. Many other apps (Teams, Slack, Tweetdeck) auto-play the GIF for a little bit and auto stop or allow the user to pause it.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: I don’t think they allow pausing but instead an arrow thing to allow hiding it
Which arrow are you talking about?

posts.name: Roch Bouchayer
posts.cooked:
Hello,

It would be nice for accessibility to be able to pause GIF and to choose when to play them.
Right now it’s playing by default and there is no way to stop them.

A good way to handle this may be to add an option to choose when to play GIF, for example on hover.

Roch

Sorry to bump but is this topic still work in Progress? It would be really nice if GIFs could be stopped or at least stop after 3 runs.

I like GIFs but it is very distracting and annoying if they run in entire loop even when you close the chat look in your chat overview where you see the conversation with alle contacts you see the GIFs still animating in very small form.

Thank you

EDIT:
I was writing regarding signal for android. First I wanted to open an “new” thread in the android section but I saw this thread and saw no reason open a new thread. Hope this is ok otherwise better to open a thread in the android section of the feature requests?

anon16909006:

otherwise better to open a thread in the android section of the feature requests?

No, the general Feature Requests category is for all platforms, so additional platform-specific topics should not be created if there is already a general feature request.

This feature was never a “work in progress”, because an existing feature request does not mean it will be/is being implemented; it simply means someone in the community requested it. The Signal team does not typically comment on which features they plan to add, but the community is fairly good at spotting commits in the repo, so if work starts being done toward an existing feature request, it will usually be updated with status. Thus, topics should not be bumped to ask for status, as it does not add anything useful.
Got it and fully agree. Thank you.

I’m here to vote for this request.
Stop looping gif everywhere:

  1. in the conversation, offer a pause button pls, some gifs drive me crazy and prevent me to concentrate on my message !!!
  2. in the home page (conversation list): no need for an animation at all. It uses ressources for 0 benefit and it breaks my concentration.

Fortunately, I’m not the only one bothered by this so we don’t use gif anymore, which is quite a shame, but better no gif than gif with infinite loop.

Request:
I would like to see an option to disable autoplay for gifs, and when played, limit the amount of iterations to 3.

Motivation:
Moving things attract attention. Once the gif has been seen, the conversation and attention move on and the animation is no longer needed.

Current workaround:
I delete the message containing the gif for me.
